message.content:
cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the problem of constructing pseudorandom generators that fool halfspaces, which is a central problem in computational complexity theory and has connections to various subfields of computer science. The use of Fourier-analytic tools and iterative dimension reduction techniques suggests that the paper may belong to cs.CC (Computational Complexity) or cs.IT (Information Theory). The focus on concentration bounds and sub-Gaussian tail behavior suggests a connection to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). Finally, the construction of generators for signed majorities suggests a connection to cs.CG (Computational Geometry).
